alert.note: Alert for Lamar; Marion; Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 10:36PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Marion, northwestern Winston and northeastern Lamar Counties through 1115 PM CST... At 1036 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Needmore to near Brinn to near Hamilton. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Haleyville, Lynn, Guin, Double Springs, Brilliant, Detroit, Houston Recreational Area, Brushy Lake, Weston, Inmanfield, Ashridge, Brinn, Lake Buttahatchee, Needmore, Moreland, Winston Free State Barn, Smith Lake, Bear Creek and Twin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Birmingham. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for central, northwestern and west central Alabama.
